Sopena Novales, P
metadata.dc:description: The coexistence of different bone diseases in the same patient involves a complex differential diagnosis. A patient is presented who was studied due to a renal mass that showed many sclerotic lesions in spine and limbs in conventional radiology and CT. These lesions were evaluated with 99mTC-HDP bone scintigraphy and 18F-FDG PET/CT, which helped to obtain the definitive pathological diagnosis of osteopoikilosis (OP) co-existing with gastric cancer bone metastases. Of the different imaging scans performed, bone scintigraphy was particularly relevant due to its ability to discriminate between benign and metastatic bone disease.

metadata.dc:title: Coexistencia de metástasis óseas por cáncer gástrico y osteopoiquilia diagnosticadas mediante gammagrafía ósea y 18F-FDG PET/TC.
Gastric cancer bone metastases together with osteopoikilosis diagnosed using bone scintigraphy and 18F-FDG PET/CT.
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista espanola de medicina nuclear e imagen molecular
